intro: Ananas var. pyramidalis, commonly known as the pineapple guava, is a tropical plant native to South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its rosette of fleshy, spiky leaves that form a central cup. The plant produces a fragrant, edible fruit that is typically small and has a unique, tangy flavor. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires a warm, humid climate to grow optimally. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruit, it is cultivated both for horticultural display and culinary use.
